flawed_nl_solution:
Christopher has 64 quarters so he has 64*0.25 = $<<64*0.25=61>>61
Karen has 32 quarters so she has 32*0.25 = $<<32*0.25=8>>8
If Christopher has $61 and Karen has $8 then Christopher has 61-8 = $<<61-8=53>>53 more than Karen

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16.0, not 61.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
